intro: Rumicastrum uniflorum, commonly known as the single-flower spurge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its succulent, ribbed stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Rumicastrum uniflorum is adapted to thrive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability.
